Description: A miniature terracotta copy of an Egyptian wine-amphora of AE 3 type, with a tapering body, ribbed neck and two high-placed handles; the mouth indicated as sealed. Modelled on one side only, the rear rounded. Solid; pressed into a one-piece mould, the back smoothed with fingers. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Perhaps acquired in the Fayum. Roman period, first to third century AD. Comparanda: Near: Allen 1985: no. 118, from Karanis, dated early fourth century AD or earlier; Petrie Museum uc67023; Spencer 1989: pl. 84:180, from Hermopolis Magna. Compare the amphorae loaded on the camel registration no. 1870,0709.35. For the amphora shape, see Tomber and Williams 2000: 44, fig. 2:6.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3671)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
